{"step_by_step_thinking": "Sentinel lymph node biopsy is a procedure used to determine if cancer has spread beyond a primary tumor into your lymphatic system. It's most useful for cancers that have a high risk of lymph node involvement. Among the options, carcinoma of the vulva has the highest risk of lymph node involvement. Carcinoma cervix, endometrium, and vagina usually spread directly and less commonly to lymph nodes.", "answer_choice": "C. Carcinoma vulva"}
